newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel gains, snaps trend.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel gains, snaps trend.

text.p: Intel Corp shares rebounded in U.S. pre-open trade Thursday, with bargain hunters reversing the stock's decline after six straight down sessions.
Before the market open, Intel stock was at $144, up from 142-1/2 at Wednesday's Nasdaq close, traders said.
"Intel is trading higher because it got murdered yesterday," a trader said, referring to a 2-1/2 point drop.

Shares in Intel, the leading computer chip maker, have been under pressure since late last week, when it dropped from about $170 per share. The decline was driven by the company's warning of below-expectation second quarter results.
"We are seeing some of the techs start to trade up, which began late yesterday," another trader said.
Dell Computer Corp rose to 106-1/2 from 104-3/4, Ascend Communications Inc added 3/8 to 48-1/4, Cascade Communications Corp added one to 33-3/4, and Microsoft Corp was at 120, up from 119-3/16.
DIGEX Inc shares rallied after agreeing to be acquired by Intermedia Communications Inc for $13 per share.
Preceding the market open, DIGEX climbed to 12-3/4 from 10-7/8, while Intermedia made no moves.
